scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists primarily of brochures and photographs from the Union Square Awards' ceremonies and events as well as photographs of organizations and their members who received financial support. Many of the photographs are undeveloped negatives and almost all of the printed photographs are in black-and-white. There are various CDs containing additional images of the organization's events throughout its history as well as logo files for the Union Square Awards. The collection also contains annual reports for the organization throughout the years 1998-2011 as well as two special reports, a 10-year report and a Social Justice Artists' Collaborative Survey Report.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Aimee Gaudette donated this collection in January 2013. The accession number associated with this gift is 2014.015.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Union Square Awards was established in 1998 to provide support for grassroots activism throughout the five boroughs of New York City. 187 organizations have received the Union Square Award, which provides a general assistance grant of $50,000 to an emerging organization as well as technical assistance and the opportunity to apply for regrants. In 2006 the Union Square Arts Award was established to recognize organizations that provide educational opportunities in the arts to low-income communities. This award consists of a $35,000 grant, technical assistance and regrant opportunities. Beginning in 2004, the Union Square Awards has provided over 300 individual grants of $25,000 to eligible organizations that had received a Union Square Award in the past and required further assistance to meet their goals.

In 2012 the Union Square Fund Board announced that it will no longer be issuing new grants to applicants. The Union Square Fund will be scaling down all activities by December 2014 and will continue to provide technical assistance and support to active grantees throughout that period.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The order in which these materials were sent to the Tamiment Library has been maintained.

appraisal.head: Appraisal note
appraisal.p: Duplicates of programs and event brochures were removed from the collection.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: During accessioning, photographic materials that were in binders were taken out of the binders and put into folders. Plastic coverings of photographs were not removed. Images on CDs were taken out of binders and placed in CD covers within a compact disc box. A collection level finding aid was created to describe the materials.
In 2014, the archived website was added as a series.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citation should take the following form:
Identification of item, date; Union Square Awards Records; TAM 645; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection are held by the Union Square Awards. Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which the Union Square Awards holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting the Union Square Awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Union Square Awards, established in 1998, awards grants to social activists, community organizers, arts organizations, and other activism in New York City. Over $16 million has been distributed to 238 organizations, since the awards founding. The website contains information on past awardees, grants, and award programs.
